translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In sweetest and most gladdening stream flow pure, O Soma, on thy way, Pressed out for Indra, for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Fiend-queller, Friend of all men, he hath with the wood attained unto His place, his iron-fashioned home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Be thou best Vṛtra-slayer, best granter of bliss, most liberal: Promote our wealthy princes' gifts.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward with thy juice unto the banquet of the Mighty Gods: Flow hither for our strength and fame.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, we draw nigh to thee, with this one object day by day: To thee alone our prayers are said

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: By means of this eternal fleece may Sūrya's Daughter purify Thy Soma that is foaming forth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Ten sister maids of slender form seize him within the press and hold Him firmly on the final day.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The virgins send him forth: they blow the the skin musician-like and fuse The triple foe-repelling meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Inviolable milch-kine round about him blend for Indra's drink, The fresh young Soma with their milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In the wild raptures of this draught, Indra slays all the Vṛtras: he, The Hero, pours his wealth on us. Next: HYMN II. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, flow on, inviting Gods, speed to the purifying cloth: Pass into Indra, as a Bull.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As mighty food speed hitherward, Indu, as a most splendid Steer: Sit in thy place as one with strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The well-loved meath was made to flow, the stream of the creative juice ne Sage drew waters to himself.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The mighty waters, yea, the floods accompany thee Mighty One, When thou wilt clothe thee with the milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The lake is brightened in the floods. Soma, our Friend, heaven's prop and stay, Falls on the purifying cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The tawny Bull hath bellowed, fair as mighty Mitra to behold: He shines together with the Sun.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Songs, Indu, active in their might are beautified for thee, wherewith Thou deckest thee for our delight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To thee who givest ample room we pray, to win the joyous draught: Great are the praise& due to thee.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu as, Indra's Friend, on us pour with a stream of sweetness, like Parjanya sender of the rain.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Winner of kine, Indu, art thou, winner of heroes, steeds, and strength Primeval Soul of sacrifice. Next: HYMN III. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: HERE present this Immortal God flies, like a bird upon her wings, To settle in the vats of wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This God, made ready with the hymn, runs swiftly through the winding ways, Inviolable as he flows.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This God while flowing is adorned, like a bay steed for war, by men Devout and skilled in holy songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, like a warrior going forth with heroes, as he flows along Is fain to win all precious boons.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This God, as he is flowing on, speeds like a car and gives his gifts: He lets his voice be heard of all

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Praised by the sacred bards, this God dives into waters, and bestows Rich gifts upon the worshipper.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Away he rushes with his stream, across the regions, into heaven, And roars as he is flowing on.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: While flowing, meet for sacrifice, he hath gone up to heaven across The regions, irresistible.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: After the 'way of ancient time, this God, pressed out for Deities, Flows tawny to the straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Lord of many Holy Laws, even at his birth engendering strength, Effused, flows onward in a stream. Next: HYMN IV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma flowing on thy way, win thou and conquer high renown; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Win thou the light, win heavenly light, and, Soma, all felicities; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Win skilful strength and mental power. O Soma, drive away our foes; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Ye purifiers, purify Soma for Indra, for his drink: Make thou us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Give us our portion in the Sun through thine own mental power and aids; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Through thine own mental power and aid long may we look upon the Sun; Make thou us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Well-weaponed Soma, pour to usa stream of riches doubly great; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As one victorious unsubdued in battle pour forth wealth to us; And make us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: By worship, Pavamana! men have strengthened thee to prop the Law: Make thou us better than we are.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, bring us wealth in steeds, manifold. quickening all life; And mate us better than we are. Next: HYMN V Āprīs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ENKINDLED, Pavamana, Lord, sends forth his light on, every side In friendly show, the bellowing Bull.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, Pavamana, Self-produced, speeds onward sharpening his horns: He glitters through the firmament.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Brilliant like wealth, adorable, with splendour Pavamana shines, Mightily with the streams of meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The tawny Pavamana, who strews from of old the grass with might, Is worshipped, God amid the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The golden, the Celestial Doors are lifted with their frames on high, By Pavamana glorified.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With passion Pavamana longs for the great lofty pair, well-formed Like beauteous maidens, Night and Dawn

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Both Gods who look on men I call, Celestial Heralds: Indra's Self Is Pavamana, yea, the Bull.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This, Pavamana's sacrifice, shall the three beauteous Goddesses, Sarasvatī and Bhāratī and Iḷā, Mighty One, attend.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: 1 summon Tvaṣṭar hither, our protector, champion, earliest-born, Indu is Indra, tawny Steer; Pavamana is Prajāpati.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, with the meath in streams anoint Vanaspati, The ever-green. the golden-hued, refulgent, with a thousand boughs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Come to the consecrating rite of Pavamana, all ye Gods,— Vāyu, Sūrya, Bṛhaspati, Indra, and Agni, in accord. Next: HYMN VI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SOMA, flow on with pleasant stream, a Bull devoted to the Gods, Our Friend, unto the woollen sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour hitherward, as Indra's Self, Indu, that gladdening stream of thine, And send us coursers full of strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow to the filter hitherward, pouring that ancient gladdening juice, Streaming forth power and high renown.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hither the sparkling drops have flowed, like waters down a steep descent They have reached Indra purified.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Whom, having passed the filter, ten dames cleanse, as ’twere a vigorous steed, While he disports him in the wood,—

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The steer-strong juice with milk pour forth, for feast and service of the Gods, To him who bears away the draught.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Effused, the God flows onward with his stream to Indra, to the God, So that his milk may strengthen him.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soul of the sacrifice, the juice effused flows quickly on: he keeps His ancient wisdom of a Sage.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: So pouring forth, as Indra's Friend, strong drink, best Gladdener! for the feast, Thou, even in secret, storest hymns. Next: HYMN VII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FORTH on their way the glorious drops have flowed for maintenance of Law, Knowing this sacrifice's course.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Down in the mighty waters sinks the stream of meath, most excellent, Oblation best of all in worth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: About the holy place, the Steer true, guileless, noblest, hath sent forth Continuous voices in the wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When, clothed in manly strength, the Sage flows in celestial wisdom round, The Strong would win the light of heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When purified, he sits as King above the hosts, among his folk, What time the sages bring him nigh.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Dear, golden-coloured, in the fleece he sinks and settles in the wood: The Singer shows his zeal in hymns.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He goes to Indra, Vāyu, to the Aśvins, as his custom is, With gladdening juice which gives them joy.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Tle streams of pleasant Soma flow to Bhaga, Mitra-Varuṇa,— Well-knowing through his mighty powers. Heaven and Earth, riches of meath to win us wealth: Gain for us treasures and renown. Next: HYMN VIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: OBEYING Indra's dear desire these Soma juices have flowed forth, Increasing his heroic might.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Laid in the bowl, pure-flowing on to Vāyu and the Aśvins, may These give us great heroic strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, as thou art purified, incite to bounty Indra's heart, To sit in place of sacrifice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The ten swift fingers deck thee forth, seven ministers impel thee on: The sages have rejoiced in thee.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When through the filter thou art poured, we clothe thee with a robe of milk To be a gladdening draught for Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When purified within the jars, Soma, brightred and golden-hued, Hath clothed him with a robe of milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow on to us and make us rich. Drive all our enemies away. O Indu, flow into thy Friend. Send down the rain from heaven, a stream of opulence from earth. Give us, O Soma, victory in war.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: May we obtain thee, Indra's drink, who viewest men and findest light, Gain thee, and progeny and food. Next: HYMN IX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE Sage of Heaven whose heart is wise, when laid between both hands and pressed, Sends us delightful powers of life.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: On, onward to a glorious home; dear to the people void of guile, With excellent enjoyment, flow.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, the bright Son, when born illumed his Parents who had sprung to life, Great Son great Strengtheners of Law.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Urged by the seven devotions he hath stirred the guileless rivers which Have magnified the Single Eye.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These helped to might theYouthful One, high over all, invincible, Even Indu, Indra! in thy law.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The immortal Courser, good to draw, looks down upon the Seven: the fount Hath satisfied the Goddesses

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Aid us in holy rites, O Man: O Pavamana, drive away Dark shades that must be met in fight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Make the paths ready for a hymn newer and newer evermore: Make the lights shine as erst they shone.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Give, Pavamana, high renown, give kine and steeds and hero sons: Win for us wisdom, win the light. Next: HYMN X. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: LIKE cars that thunder on their way, like coursers eager for renown, Have Soma-drops flowed forth for wealth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Forth have they rushed from holding hands, like chariots that are urged to speed, Like joyful songs of singing-men.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Somas deck themselves with milk, as Kings are graced with eulogies, And, with seven priests, the sacrifice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pressed for the gladdening draught, the drops flow forth abundantly with song, The Soma juices in a stream.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Winning Vivasvān's glory and producing Morning's light, the Suns Pass through the openings of the cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The singing-men of ancient time open the doors of sacred songs,— Men, for the mighty to accept.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Combined in close society sit the seven priests, the brother-hood, Filling the station of the One.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He gives us kinship with the Gods, and with the Sun unites our eye: The Sage's ofrspring hath appeared.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Sun with his dear eye beholds that quarter of the heavens which priests Have placed within the sacred cell. Next: HYMN XL Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SING forth to Indu, O ye men, to him who is purified, Fain to pay worship to the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Together with thy pleasant juice the Atharvans have commingled milk, Divine, devoted to the God.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Bring, by thy flowing, weal to kine, weal to the people, weal to steeds. Weal, O thou King, to growing plants

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Sing a praise-song to Soma brown of hue, of independent might. The Red, who reaches up to heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Purify Soma when effused with stones which bands move rapidly, And pour the sweet milk in the meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With humble homage draw ye nigh; blend the libation with the curds: To Indra offer Indu up.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, foe-que chief o’er men, doing the will of pour forth Prosperity upon our kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Heart-knower, Sovran of the heart, thou art effused, O Soma, that Indra may drink thee and rejoice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma Pavamana, give us riches and heroic strength,— Indu! with. Indra for ally. Next: HYMN XII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Indra have the Soma drops, exceeding rich in sweets, been poured, Shed in the seat of sacrifice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As mother kine low to their calves, to Indra have the sages called, Called him to drink the Soma juice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In the stream's wave wise Soma dwells, distilling rapture, in his seat, Resting upon a wiId-cow's hide.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Far-sighted Soma, Sage and Seer, is worshipped in the central point Of heaven, the straining-cloth of wool.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In close embraces Indu holds Soma when poured within the jars. And on the. purifying sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu sends forth a voice on high to regions of the sea of air, Shaking the vase that drops with meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Tree whose praises never fail yields heavenly milk among our hymns, Urging men's generations on.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Wise One, with the Sage's stream, the Soma urged to speed, flows on To the dear places of the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, bring us wealth bright with a thousand splendours. Yea. O Indu, give us ready help. Next: HYMN XIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: PASSED through, the fleece in thousand streams the Soma, purified, flows on To Indra's, Viyu's special place.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Sing forth, ye men who long for help, to Pavamana, to the Sage, Effused to entertain the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Soma-drops with thousand powers are purified for victory, Hymned to become the feast of Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Yea, as thou flowest bring great store of food that we may win the spoil Indu, bring splendid manly might.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: May they in flowing give us wealth in thousands, and heroic power,— These Godlike Soma-drops effused.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Like coursers by their drivers urged, they were poured forth, for victory, Swift through the woollen straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Noisily flow the Soma-drops, like milch-kine lowing to their calves: They have run forth from both the hands.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As Gladdener whom Indra loves, O Pavamana, with a roar Drive all our enemies away.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamamas, driving off the godless, looking on the light, Sit in the place of sacrifice. Next: HYMN XIV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: REPOSING on the river's wave the Sage hath widely flowed around, Bearing the hymn which many love.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When the Five kindred Companies, active in duty, with the song Establish him, the Powerful,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Then in his juice whose strength is great, have all the Gods rejoiced themselves, When he hath clothed him in the milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Freeing himself he flows away, leaving his body's severed limbs, And meets his own Companion here.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He by the daughters of the priest, like a fair youth, hath been adorned, Making the milk, as ’twere, his robe.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O'er the fine fingers, through desire of milk, in winding course he goes, And utters voice which he hath found.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The nimble fingers have approached, adorning him the Lord of Strength: They grasp the vigorous Courser's back.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Comprising all the treasures that are in the heavens and on the earth, Come, Soma, as our faithful Friend. Next: HYMN XV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THROUGH the fine fingers, with the song, this Hero comes with rapid ears, Going to Indra's special place.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In holy thought he ponders much for the great worship of the Gods. Where the Immortals have their seat.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Like a good horse is he led out, when on the path that shines with light The mettled steeds exert their strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He brandishes his horns on high, and whets them Bull who leads the herd, Doing with might heroic deeds.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He moves, a vigorous Steed, adorned with beauteous rays of shining gold, Becoming Sovran of the streams.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, over places rough to pass, bringing rich treasures closely packed. Descends into the reservoirs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Men beautify him in the vats, him worthy to be beautified, Him who brings forth abundant food.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him, even him, the fingers ten and the seven songs make beautiful, Well-weaponed, best of gladdeners. Next: HYMN XVI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE pressers from the Soma-press send forth thy juice for rapturous joy The speckled sap runs like a flood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With strength we follow through the sieve him who brings might and wins the kine, Enrobed in water with his juice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour on the sieve the Soma, ne’er subdued in waters, waterless, And make it pure for Indra's drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Moved by the purifier's thought, the Soma flows into the sieve: By wisdom it hath gained its home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With humble homage, Indra, have the Soma-drops flowed forth to thee, Contending for the glorious prize.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Purified in his fleecy garb, attaining every beauty, he Stands, hero-like, amid the kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Swelling, as ’twere, to heights of heaven, the stream of the creative juice Falls lightly on the cleansing sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thus, Soma, purifying himwho knoweth song mid living men, Thou wanderest through the cloth of wool. Next: HYMN XVII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: LIKE rivers down a steep descent, slaying the Vṛtras, full of zeal, The rapid Soma-streams have flowed.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The drops of Soma juice effused fall like the rain upon the earth: To Indra flow the Soma-streams.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With swelling wave the gladdening drink, the Soma, flows intoṭhe sieve, Loving the Gods and slaying fiends.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: It hastens to the pitchers, poured upon the sieve it waxes strong At sacrifices through the lauds.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, thou shinest mounting heaven as ’twere above light's triple realm, And moving secm'st to speed the Sun.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To him, the head of sacnfice, singers and bards have sung their songs, Offering what he loves to see.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The men, the sages with their hymns, eager for help, deck thee strong &teed, Deck thee for service of the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward to the stream of meath rest efficacious in thy home, Fair, to be drunk at sacrifice. Next: HYMN XVIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THOU, Soma, dweller on the hills, effused, hast flowed into the sieve,: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou art a sacred Bard, a Sage; the meath is offipring of thy sap: All-bountcous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: All Deities of one accord have come that they may drink of thee: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He who containeth in his hands all treasures much to be desired: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Who milketh out this mighty Pair, the Earth and Heaven, like mother kine All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Who in a moment mightily floweth around these two world-halvcs: All-bounteous art thou in carouse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Strong One, being purified, hath in the pitchers cried aloud: All-bounteous art thou in carouse. Next: HYMN XIX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O SOMA, being purified bring us the wondrous treasure, meet For lauds, that is in earth and heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For ye Twain, Indra, Soma, are Lords of the light, Lords of the kine: Great Rulers, prosper ye our songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The tawny Steer, while cleansed among the living, bellowing on the grass, Hath sunk and settled in his home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Over the Steer's productive flow the sacred songs were resonant, The mothers of the darling Son.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hath he not, purified, impregned the kine whb long to meet their Lord, The kine who yield the shining milk?

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Bring near us those who stand aloof strike fear into our enemies: O Pavamana, find us wealth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, bring down the foeman's might, his vigorous strength and vital powe'r, Whether he be afar or near. Next: HYMN XX Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FORTH through the straining-cloth the Sage flows to the banquet of the Gods, Subduing all our enemies.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For he, as Pavamana, sends thousandfold treasure in the shape Of cattle to the singing-men.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou graspest all things with thy mind, and purifiest thee with thoughts As such, O Soma, find us fame.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour lofty glory on us, send sure riches to our liberal lords, Bring food to those who sing thy praise.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As thou art cleansed, O Wondrous Steed, O Soma, thou hast entered, like A pious King, into the songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, Soma, like a courser in the floods invincible, made clean With hands, is resting in the jars.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Disporting, like a liberal chief, thou goest, Soma, to the sieve, Lending the laud a Hero's strength. Next: HYMN XXI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Indra flow these running drops, these Somas frolicsome in mood. Exhilarating, finding light;

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Driving off foes, bestowing room upon the presser, willingly Bringing their praiser vitalforce.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Lightly disporting them, the drops flow to one common reservoir, And fall into the river's wave.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These Pavamanas have obtained all blessings much to be desired, Like coursers harnessed to a car.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With view to us, O Soma-drops, bestow his manifold desire On him who yet hath given us naught.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Bring us our wish with this design, as a wright brings his new-wrought wheel: Flow pure and shining with the stream.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These drops have cried with resonant voice: like swift steeds they have run the course, And roused the good man's hymn to life. Next: HYMN XXII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THESE rapid Soma-streams have stirred themselves to motion like strong steeds, Like cars, like armies hurried forth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Swift as wide winds they lightly move, like rain-storms of Parjanya, like The flickering flames of burning fire.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These Soma juices, blent with curds, purified, skilled in sacred hymns, Have gained by song their hearts'desire.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Immortal, cleansed, these drops, since first they flowed, have never wearied, fain To reach the regions and their paths.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Advancing they have travelled o’er the ridges of the earth and heaven, And this the highest realm of all.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Over the heights have they attained the highest thread that is spun out, And this which must be deemed most high.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Soma, boldest wealth in kine which thou hast seized from niggard churls: Thou calledst forth the outspun thread. Next: HYMN XXIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SWIFT Soma drops have been effused in streams of meath, the gladdening drink, For sacred lore of every kind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hither to newer. resting-place the ancient Living Ones are come. They made the Sun that he might shine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, bring to us the unsacrificing foeman's wealth, And give us food with progeny.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The living Somas being cleansed diffuse exhilarating drink, Turned to the vat which drips with meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma gows on intelligent, possessing sap and mighty strength, Brave Hero who repels the curse.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra, Soma! thou art cleansed, a feast-companion for the Gods:

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ndu, thou fain wilt win us strength

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When he had drunken draughts of this, Indra smote down resistless foes: Yea, smote them, and shall smite them still. Next: HYMN XXIVṢoma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: HITHERWARD have the Soma streamed, the drops while they are purified: When bIent, in waters they are rinsed.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The milk hath run to meet them like floods rushing down a precipice: They come to Indra, being cleansed.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma Pavamana, thou art flowing to be Indra's drink: The men have seized and lead thee forth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Victorious, to be hailed with joy, O Soma, flow, delighting men, To him who ruleth o’er mankind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Indu, when, effused by stones, thou runnest to the filter, art, Ready for Indra's high decree.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow on, best Vṛtra-slayer; flow meet to be hailed with joyful lauds. Pure, purifying, wonderful.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pure, purifying is he called the Soma of the meath eflused, Slayer of sinners, dear to Gods. Next: HYMN XXV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: GREEN-HUED! as one who giveth strength flow on for Gods to drink, a draught For Vāyu and the Marut host.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, sent by song, roaring about thy dwelling-place, Pass into Vāyu as Law bids.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Steer shines with the Deities, dear Sage in his appointed home, Foe-Slayer, most beloved by Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Taking each beauteous form, he goes, desirable, while purified, Thither where- the Immortals sit.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Indra Soma flows, the Red, engendering song, exceeding wise, The visitor of living men.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow, best exhilarator, Sage, flow to the filter in a stream To seat thee in the place of song. Next: HYMN XXVI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE sages with the fingers' art have dressed and decked that vigorous Steed Upon the lap of Aditi,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The kine have called aloud to him exhaustless with a thousand streams, To Indu who supporteth heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him, nourisher of many, Sage, creative Pavamana, they Have sent, by wisdom, to the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him, dweller with Vivasvān, they with use of both arms have sent forth, The Lord of Speech infallible.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him, green, beloved, many eyed, the Sisters with prosing stones Send down to ridges of the sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, Indu, priests hurry thee on to Indra, thee Who aidest song and cheerest him. Next: HYMN XXVII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THIS Sage, exalted by our lauds, flows to the purifying cloth, Scattering foes as he is cleansed.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As giving power and winning light, for Indra and for Vāyu he Is poured upon the filtering-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The men conduct him, Soma, Steer, Omniscient, and the Head of Heaven, Effused into the vats of wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Longing for kine, longing for gold hath Indu Pavamana lowed, Still Conqueror, never overcome.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Pavamana, gladdening draught, drops on the filtering cloth, and then Mounts up with Sūrya to the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Indra in the firmament this mighty tawny Steer hath flowed, This Indu, being purified. Next: HYMN XXVIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: URGED by the men, this vigorous Steed, Lord of the mind, Omniscient, Runs to the woollen straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Within the filter hath he flowed, this Soma for the Gods effused, Entering all their essences.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He shines in beauty there, this God Immortal in his dwelling-place, Foe-slayer, dearest to the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Directed by the Sisters ten, bellowing on his way this Steer Runs onward to the wooden vats.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Pavamana, swiftand strong, Omniscient, gave spleudour to The Sun and all his forms of light.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Soma being purified, flows mighty and infallible, Slayer of sinners, dear toGods. Next: HYMN XXIX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FORWARD with mighty force have flowed the currents of this Steer effused, Of him who sets him by the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The singers praise him with their song, and learned priests adorn the Steed, Brought forth as light that merits laud.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These things thou winnest lightly while purified, Soma, Lord of wealth: Fill full the sea that claims our praise.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Winning all precious things at once, flow on, O Soma, with thy stream Drive to one place our enemies.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Preserve us from the godless, from ill-omened voice of one and all, That so we may be freed from blame.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, as thou flowest on bring us the wealth of earth and heaven, And splendid vigour, in thy stream. Next: HYMN XXX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: STREAMS of this Potent One have flowed easily to the straining-cloth: While he is cleansed he lifts his voice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, by pressers urged to speed, bellowing out while beautified. Sends forth a very mighty sound.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour on us, Soma, with thy stream manconquering might which many crave, Accompanied with hero sons.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hither hath Pavamana flowed, Soma flowed hither in a stream, To settle in the vats of wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To waters with the stones they drive thee tawny-hued, most rich in sweets, O Indu, to be Indra's drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra, for the Thunderer press the Soma very rich in sweets, Lovely, inspiriting, for strength. Next: HYMN XXXI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE, Soma-drops, benevolent, come forth as they are purified, Bestowing wealth which all may see.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, high o’er heaven and earth be thou, increaser of our might: The Master of all strength be thou.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The winds are gracious in their love to thee, the rivers flow to thee Soma, they multiply thy power.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, wax great. From every side may vigorous powers unite in thee: Be in the gathering-Place of strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For thee, brown-hued! the kine have poured imperishable oil and milk. Aloft on the sublimest height.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Friendship, O Indu, we desire with thee who bearest noble arms, With thee, O Lord of all that is. Next: HYMN XXXII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE rapture-shedding Soma-drops, effused in our assembly, have Flowed forth to glorify our prince.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Then Trita's Maidens onward urge the Tawny-coloured with the stones, Indu for Indra, for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Now like a swan he maketh all the company sing each his hymn: He, like a steed, is bathed in milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma, viewing heaven and earth, thou runncst like a darting deer Set in the place of sacrifice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The cows have sung with joy to him, even as a woman to her love He came as to a settled race.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Bestow illustrious fame on us, both on our liberal lords and me, Glory, intelligence, and wealth. Next: HYMN XXXIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: LIKE waves of waters, skilled in song the juices of the Soma speed Onward, as buffaloes to woods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With stream of sacrifice the brown bright drops have flowed with strength in store Of kine into the wooden vats.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Indra, Vāyu, Varuṇa, to Viṣṇu, and the Maruts, flow The drops of Soma juice effused.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Three several words are uttered: kine are ]owing, cows who give their milk: The Tawny-hued goes bellowing on.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The young and sacred mothers of the holy rite have uttered praise: They decorate the Child of Heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: From every side, O Soma, for our profit, pour thou forth four seas Filled full of riches thousandfold. Next: HYMN XXXIV. Some Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE drop of Soma juice effused flows onward with this stream impelled. Rending strong places with its might.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Poured forth to Indra, Varuṇa, to Vāyu and the Marut hosts, To Viṣṇu, flows the Soma juice.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With stones they press the Soma forth, the Strong conducted by the strong: They milk the liquor out with skill.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ’Tis he whom Trita must refine, ’tis he who shall make Indra glad: The Tawny One is decked with tints.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him do the Sons of Pṛśni milk, the dwelling-place of sacrifice, Oblation lovely and most dear.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To him in one unitcd stream th-,se songs flow on straight forward. he, Loud voiced, hath made the milch-kine low. Next: HYMN XXXV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour forth on us abundant wealth, O Pavamana, with thy stream. Wherewith thou mayest find us light

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, swayer of the sea, shaker of all things, flow thou on, Bearer of wealth to us with might.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With thee for Hero, Valiant One! may we subdue our enemies: Let what is precious flow to us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu arouses strength the Sage who strives for victory, winning power, Discovering holy works and means.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Mover of speech, we robe him with our songs as he is purified Soma, the Guardian of the folk;

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: On whose way, Lord of Holy Law, most richi as he is purified. The people all have set their hearts. Next: HYMN XXXVI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FORTH from the mortar is the juice sent, like a car-horse, to the sieve: The Steed steps forward to the goal.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thus, Soma, watchful, bearing well, cheering the Gods, flow past the sieve, Turned to the vat that drops with meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Excellent Pavamana, make the lights shine brightly out for us. Speed us to mental power and skill.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, beautified by pious men, and coming from their hands adorned, Flows through the fleecy straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: May Soma pour all treasures of the heavens, the earth, the firmament Upon the liberal worshipper.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou mountest to the height of heaven, O Soma, seeking steeds and kine, And seeking heroes, Lord of Strength! Next: HYMN XXXVII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SOMA, the Steer, effused for draught, flows to the purifying sieve, Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Far-sighted, tawny-coloured, he flows to the sieve, intelligent, Bellowing, to his place of rest.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This vigorous Pavamana runs forth to the luminous realm of heaven, Fiend-slayer, through the fleecy sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Payamana up above Trita's high ridge hath made the Sun, Together with the Sisters, shine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Vṛtra-slaying Steer, effused, Soma room-giver, ne’er deceived, Hath gone, as ’twere, to win the spoil.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Urged onward by the sage, the God speeds forward to the casks of wood, Indu to Indra willingly. Next: HYMN XXXVIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THIS Steer, this Chariot, rushes through the woollen filter, as he goes To war that wins a thousand spoils.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Dames of Trita with the stones onward impel this Tawny One Indu to Indra for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Ten active fingers carefully adorn him here; they make him bright And beauteous for the gladdening draught.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He like a falcon settles down amid the families of men. Speeding like lover to his love.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This young exhilarating juice looks downward from its place in heaven, This Soma-drop that pierced the sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Poured for the draught, this tawny juice flows forth, intelligent, crying out, Unto the well-beloved place. Next: HYMN XXXIX Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FLOW On, O thou of lofty thought, flow swift in thy beloved form, Saying, I go where dwell the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Preparing what is unprepared, and bringing store of food to man, Make thou the rain descend from heaven.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With might, bestowing power, thejuice enters the purifying sieve, Far-seeing, sending forth its light.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This is it which in rapid course hath with the river's wave flowed down From heaven upon the straining cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Inviting him frorh far away, and even from near at hand, the juice For Indra is poured forth as meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In union they have sung the hymn: with stones they urge the Tawny One. Sit in the place of sacrifice. Next: HYMN XL. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THE Very Active hath assailed, while purified, all enemies: They deck the Sage with holy songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Red hath mounted to his place; to India, goes the mighty juice: He settles in his firm abode.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, Soma, send us now great opulence from every side, Pour on us treasures thousandfold.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma Pavamana, bring, Indu, all splcndours hitherward: Find for us food in boundless store.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As thou art cleansed, bring hero strength and riches to thy worshipper, And prosper thou the singer's hymns.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Indu, Soma, being cleansed, bring hither riches doublypiled, Wealth, mighty Indu, meet for lauds. Next: HYMN XLI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ACTIVE and bright have they come forth, impetuous in speed like bulls, Driving the black skin far away.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Quelling the riteless Dasyu, may we think upon the bridge of bliss, Leaving the bridge of woe behind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The mighty Pavamana's roar is heard as ’twere the rush of rain Lightnings are flashing to the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour out on us abundant food, when thou art pressed, O Indu wealth In kine and gold and steeds and spoil.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow on thy way, Most Active, thou. fill full the mighty heavens and earth, As Dawn, as Sūrya with his beams.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: On every side, O Soma, flow round us with thy protecting stream, As Rasā flows around the world. Next: HYMN XLII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ENGENDERING the Sun in floods, engendering heaven's lights, green-hued, Robed in the waters and the milk,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: According to primeval plan this Soma, with his stream, effused Flows purely on, a God for Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For him victorious, waxen great, the juices with a thousand powers Are purified for winning spoil.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Shedding the ancient fluid he is poured into the cleansing sieve: He, thundering, hath produced the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, while purifying, sends hither all things to be desired, He sends the Gods who strengthen Law.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, effused, pour on us wealth in kine, in heroes, steeds, and spoil, Send us abundant store of food. Next: HYMN XLIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: WE will enrobe with sacred song the Lovely One who, as a Steed, Is decked with milk for rapturous joy.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: All songs of ours desiring grace adorn him in the ancient way, Indu for Indra, for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma flows on when purified, beloved and adorned with songs, Songs of the sage Medhyātithi.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma Pavamana, find exceeding glorious wealth for us, Wealth, Indu, fraught with boundless might.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Like courser racing to the prize Indu, the lover of the Gods, Roars, as he passes, in the sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow on thy way to win us strength, to speed the sage who praises thee: Soma, bestow heroic power. Next: HYMN XLIV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: INDU, to us for this great rite, bearing as ’twere thy wave to Gods, Unwearied, thou art flowing forQh.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pleased with the hymn, impelled by prayer, Soma is hurried far away, The Wise One in the Singer's stream.,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Watchful among the. gods, this juice advances to the cleansing sieve Soma, most active, travels on.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward, seeking strength for us, embellishing the sacrifice: The priest with trimmed grass calleth thee.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: May Soma, ever bringing power to Bhaga and to Vāyu, Sage And Hero, lead us to the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: So, to increase our wealth to-day, Inspirer, best of Furtherers, Win for us strength and high renown. Next: HYMN XLV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FLOW, thou who viewest men, to give delight, to entertain the Gods, Indu, to Indra for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Stream to thine embassy for us: thou hastenest, for Indra, to The Gods, O better than our friends.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: We balm thee, red of hue, with milk to fit thee for the rapturous joy: Unbar for us the doors of wealth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He through the sieve hath passed, as comes a courser to the pole, to run Indu belongs unto the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: All friends have lauded him as he sports in the wood, beyond the fleece: Singers have chanted Indu's praise.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow, Indu, with that stream wherein steeped thou announcest to the man Who worships thee heroic strength. Next: HYMN XLVI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: LIKE able coursers they have been sent forth to be the feast of Gods, joying in mountains, flowing on.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To Vāyu flow the Soma-streams, the drops of juice made beautiful Like a bride dowered by her sire.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pressed in the mortar, these, the drops of juice, the Somas rich in food, Give strength to Indra with their work.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Deft-handed men, run hither, seize the brilliant juices blent with meal, And cook with milk the gladdening draught.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thus, Soma, Conqueror of wealth! flow, finding furtherance for us, Giver oF ample opulence.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: This Pavamana, meet to be adorned, the fingers ten adorn, The draught that shall make Indra glad. Next: HYMN XLVII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: GREAT as he was, Soma hath gained strength by this high solemnity: joyous he riseth like a bull.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: His task is done: his crushings of the Dasyus are made manifest: He sternly reckoneth their debts.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soon as his song of praise is born, the Soma, Indra's juice, becomes A thousand-winning thunderbolt.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Seer and Sustainer, he himself desireth riches for the sage When he embellisheth his songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Fain would they both win riches as in races of the steeds. In war Thou art upon the conquerors' side. Next: HYMN XLVIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: WITH sacrifice we seek to thee kind Cherisher of manly might In mansions of the lofty heavens;

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Gladdening crusher of the bold, ruling with very mighty sway, Destroyer of a hundred forts.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hence, Sapient One! the Falcon, strong of wing, unwearied, brought thee down, Lord over riches, from the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: That each may see the light, the Bird brought us the guard of Law, the Friend Of all, the speeder through the air.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: And now, sent forth, it hath attained to mighty power and majesty, Most active, ready to assist. Next: HYMN XLIX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Poust down the rain upon us, pour a wave of waters from the sky, And plenteous store of wholesome fbod.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward with that stream of thine, whereby the cows have come to us, The kine of strangers to our home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Chief Friend of Gods in sacred rites, pour on us fatness with thy stream, Ppur down on us a flood of rain.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: To give us vigour, with thy stream run through the fleecy straining-cloth For verily the Gods will bear.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Onward hath Pavamana flowed and beaten off the Rākṣasas, Flashing out splendour as of old. Next: HYMN L. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: LOUD as a river's roaring wave thy powers have lifted up themselves: Urge on thine arrow's sharpened point.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: At thine effusion upward rise three voices full of joy, when thou Flowest upon the fleecy ridge.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: On to the fleece they urge with stone the tawny well-beloved One, Even Pavamana, dropping meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow with thy current to the sieve, O Sage most powerful to cheer, To seat thee in the place of song.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow, Most Exhilarating! flow anointed with the milk for balm, Indu, for Indra, for his drink. Next: HYMN LI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: ADHVARYU, on the filter pour the Soma juice expressed with stones, And make it pure for Indra's drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour out for Indra, Thunder-armed, the milk of heaven,, the Soma's juice, Most excellent, most rich in sweets.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These Gods and all the Marut host, Indu enjoy this juice of thine, This Pavamana's flowing meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For, Soma, thou hast been effused, strengthening for the wild carouse, O Steer, the singer, for our help.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow with thy stream, Far-sighted One, effused, into the cleansing sieve: Flow on to give us strength and fame. Next: HYMN LII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: WEALTH-WINNER, dwelling in the sky, bringing us vigour with the juice, Flow to the filter when effused.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: So, in thine ancient ways, may he, beloved, with a thousand streams Run o’er the fleecy straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him who is like a caldron shake: O Indu, shake thy gift to us Shake it, armed Warrior! with thine arms.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, invoked with many a prayer, bring down the vigour of these men, Of him who threatens us with war.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, Wealth-giver, with thine help pour out for us a hundred, yea, A thousand of thy pure bright streams. Next: HYMN LIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O THOU with stones for arms, thy powers, crushing the fiends, have raised themselves: Chase thou the foes who compass us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou conquerest thus with might when car meets car, and when the prize is staked: With fearless heart will I sing praise.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: No one with evil thought assails this Pavamana's holy laws: Crush him who fain would fight with thee.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra to the streams they drive the tawny rapture-dropping Steed, Indu the bringer of delight. Next: HYMN LIV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: AFTER his ancient splendour, they, the bold, have drawn the bright milk from The Sage who wins a thousand gifts.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: In aspect he is like the Sun; he runneth forward to the lakes, Seven currents flowing through the sky.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, shining in his splendour, stands high over all things that exist- Soma, a God as Sūrya is.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Indu, in thy brilliancy, pourest on us, as Indra's Friend, Wealth from the kine to feast the Gods. Next: HYMN LV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: POUR on us with thy juice all kinds of corn, each sort of nourishment, And, Soma, all felicities.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As thine, O Indu, is the praise, and thine what springeth from the juice, Seat thee on the dear sacred grass.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: And, finding for us kine and steeds, O Soma, with thy juice flow on Through days that fly most rapidly.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As one who conquers, ne’er subdued, attacks and stays the enemy, Thus, Vanquisher of thousands! flow. Next: HYMN LVI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SWIFT to the purifying sieve flows Soma as exalted Law, Slaying the fiends, loving the Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: When Soma pours the strengthening food a hundred ever-active streams To Indra's friendship win theirway.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Ten Dames have sung to welcome thee, even as a maiden greets her love: O Soma, thou art decked to win.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow hitherward, O Indu, sweet to Indra and to Viṣṇu: guard The men, the singers, from distress. Next: HYMN LVII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THY streams that never fail or waste flow forth like showers of rain from heaven, To bring a thousand stores of strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He flows beholding on his way all wellbeloved sacred lore, Green-tinted, brandishing his, arms.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, when the people deck him like a docile king of elephants. Sits as a falcon in the, wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: So bring thou hitherward to us, Indu, while thou art purified, All treasures both of heaven and earth. Next: HYMN LVIII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SWIFT runs this giver of delight, even the stream of flowing juice: Swift runs this giver of delight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Morning knows all precious things, the Goddess knows her grace to man: Swift runs this giver of delight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: We have accepted thousands from Dhvasra's and Puruṣanti's hands: Swift runs this giver of delight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: From whom we have accepted thus thousands and three times ten beside: Swift runs this giver of delight. Next: HYMN LIX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FLOW onward, Soma, winning kine, and steeds, and all that gives delight: Bring hither wealth with progeny.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward from the waters, flow, inviolable, from the plants: Flow onward from the pressing-boards.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, as Pavamana, pass over all trouble and distress: Sit on the sacred grass, a Sage.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Pavamana, foundest light; thou at thy birth becamest great: O Indu, thou art over all. Next: HYMN LX. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: SING forth and laud with sacred song most active Pavamana, laud Indu who sees with thousand eyes.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thee who hast thousand eyes to see, bearer of thousand burthens, they Have filtered through the fleecy cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, Pavamana, hath streamed through the fleece then: he runs into the jars, Finding his way to Indra's heart.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: That Indra may be bounteous, flow, most active Soma, for our weal: Bring genial seed with progeny. Next: HYMN LXI. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: FLOW onward, Indu, with this food for him who in thy wild delight Battered the nine-and-ninety down,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Smote swiftly forts, and gambara, then Yadu and that Turvaga, For pious Divodāsa's sake.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Finder of horses, pour on us horses and wealth in kine and gold, And, Indu, food in boundless store.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: We seek to win thy friendly love, even Pavamana's flowing o’er The limit of the cleansing sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With those same waves which in their stream oyerflow the purifying sieve, Soma; be gracious unto us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma, being purified, bring us from all sides,—for thou canst,— Riches and food with hero sons.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Him here, the Child whom streams have borne, the ten swift fingers beautify With the Ādityas is he seen.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: With Indra and with Vāyu he, effused, flows onward with,the beams Of Sūrya to the cleansing sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow rich in sweets and lovely for our Bhaga, Vāyu, Pūṣan flow For Mitra and for Varuṇa.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: High is thy juice's birth: though set in heaven, on earth it hath obtained Strong sheltering power and great renown.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Striving to win, with him we gain all wealth from the ungodly man, Yea, all the glories of mankind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Finder of room and freedom, flow for Indra whom we must adore, For Varuṇa and the Marut host.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Gods have come to Indu well-descended, beautified with milk, The active crusher of the foe.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Even as mother cows their calf, so let our praise-songs strengthen him, Yea, him who winneth Indra's heart.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, pour blessings on our kine, pour forth the food that streams with milk Increase the sea that merits laud.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: From heaven hath Pavamana made, as ’twere, the marvellous thunder, and The lofty light of all mankind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The gladdening and auspicious juice of thee, of Pavamana, King! Flows o’er the woollen straining-cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thy juice, O Pavamana, sends its rays abroad like splendid skill, Like lustre, all heaven's light, to see.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward with that juice of thine most excellent, that brings delight, Slaying the wicked, dear to Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Killing the foeman and his hate, and winning booty every day, Gainer art thou of steeds and kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Red-hued, be blended with the milk that seems to yield its lovely breast, Falcon-like resting in thine home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward thou who strengthenedst Indra to slaughter Vṛtra who Compassed and stayed the mighty floods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma who rainest gifts, may we win riches with our hero sons: Strengthen, as thou art cleansed, our hymns.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Aided by thee, and through thy grace, may we be slayers when we war: Watch, Soma, at our solemn rites.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Chasing our foemen, driving off the godless, Soma flowcth on, Going to Indra's special place.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Pavamana, hither bring great riches, and destroy our foes: O Indu, grant heroic fame.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: A hundred obstacles have ne’er checked thee when fain to give thy boons, When, being cleansed, thou combatest.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, flow on, a mighty juice; glorify us among the folk: Drive all our enemies away.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, in this thy friendship most lofty and glorious may we Subdue all those who war with us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Those awful weapons that thou hast, sharpened at point to strike men down- Guard us therewith from every foe. Next: HYMN LXII. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: THESE rapid Soma-drops have been poured through the purifying sieve To bring us all felicities.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Dispelling manifold mishap, giving the courser's progeny, Yea, and the warrior steed, success.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Bringing prosperity to kine, they make perpetual Iḷā flow To us for noble eulogy.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Strong, mountain-born, the stalk hath been pressed in the streams for rapturous joy: Hawk-like he settles in his home.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Fair is the God-loved juice; the plant is washed in waters, pressed by men The milch-kine sweeten it with milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As drivers deck a courser, so have they adorned the meath's juice for Ambrosia, for the festival.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Indu, with thy streams that drop sweet juices, which were poured for help, Hast settled in the cleansing sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: So flow thou onward through the fleece, for Indra flow, to be his drink, Finding thine home in vats of wood.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: As giving room and freedom, as most sweet, pour butter forth and milk, O Indu, for the Aṅgirases.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Most active and benevolent, this Pavamana, sent to us For lofty friendship, meditates.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Queller of curses, mighty, with strong sway, this Pavamana shall Bring treasures to the worshipper.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour thou upon us thousandfold possessions, both of kine and steeds, Exceeding glorious, much-desired.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Wandering far, with wise designs, the juice here present is effused, Made beautiful by living men.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra flows the gladdening drink, the measurer of the region, Sage, With countless wealth and endless help.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Born on the inountain, lauded here, Indu for Indra is set down, As in her sheltering nest a bird.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pressed by the men, as ’twere to war hath Soma Pavamana sped, To test with might within the vats.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: That he may move, they yoke him to the three-backed triple-seated car By the Seven Ṛṣis’ holy songs.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Drive ye that Tawny Courser, O ye pressers, on his way to war, Swift Steed who carries off the spoil.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pouring all glories hither, he, effused and entering the jar, Stands like a hero mid the kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, the living men milk out the juice to make the rapturous draught: Gods for the Gods milk out the meath.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour for the Gods into the sieve our Soma very rich in sweets, Him whom the Gods most gladly hear.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Into his stream who gladdens best these Soma juices have been poured, Lauded with songs for lofty fame.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou flowest to enjoy the milk, and bringest valour, being cleansed: Winning the spoil flow hitherward.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: And, hymned by Jamadagnis, let all nourishment that kine supply, And general praises, flow to us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, as leader of the song flow onward with thy wondrous aids, For holy lore of every kind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Do thou as leader of the song, stirring the waters of the sea, Flow onward, thou who movest all.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma, O thou Sage, these worlds stand ready to attest thy might: For thy behoof the rivers flow.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Like showers of rain that fall from heaven thy streams perpetually flow To the bright fleece spread under them.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For potent Indra purify Indu effectual and strong, Enjoyment-giver, Mighty Lord.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, true, Pavamana, Sage, is seated in the cleansing sieve, Giving his praiser hero strength. Next: HYMN LXIII. Soma Pavanana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: POUR hitherward, O Soma, wealth in thousands and heroic strength, And keep renown secure for us.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou makest food and vigour swell for Indra, best of gladdeners! Within the cups thou seatest thee.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra and for Viṣṇu poured, Soma hath flowed into the jar: May Vāyu find it rich in sweets.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These Somas swift and brown of hue, in stream of solemn sacrifice Have flowed through twisted obstacles,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Performing every noble work, active, augmenting Indra's strength, Driving away the godless ones.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Brown Soma-drops, effused that seek Indra, to their appropriate place Flow through the region hitherward.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward with that stream of thine wherewith thou gavest Sūrya light, Urging on waters good to men.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: He, Pavamana, high o’er man yoked the Sun's courser Etaśa To travel through the realm of air.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: And those ten Coursers, tawny-hued, he harnessed that the Sun might come Indu, he said, is Indra's self.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Hence, singers, pour the gladdeningjuice to Vāyu and to Indra, pour The drops upon the fleecy cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma Pavamana, find wealth for us not to be assailed, Wealth which the foeman may not win.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Send riches hither with thy stream in thousands, both of steeds and kine, Send spoil of war and high renown.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma the God, expressed with stones, like Sūrya, floweth on his way, Pouring the juice within the jar.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These brilliant drops have poured for us, in stream of solemn sacrifice, Worshipful laws and strength in kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Over the cleansing sieve have flowed the Somas, blent with curdled milk, Effused for Indra Thunder-armed.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, do thou most rich in sweets, a gladdening drink most dear to Gods, Flow to the sieve to bring us wealth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra, living men adorn the Tawny Courser in the streams, Indu, the giver of delight.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Pour for us, Soma, wealth in gold, in horses and heroic sons, Bring hither strength in herds of kine.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: For Indra pour ye on the fleece him very sweet to taste, who longs. For battle as it were in war.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The singers, seeking help, adorn the Sage who must be decked with songs: Loud bellowing the Steer comes on,

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The singers with their thoughts and hymns have, in the stream of sacrifice, Caused Soma, active Steer, to roar.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: God, working with mankind, flow on; to Indra go thy gladdening juice: To Vāyu mount as Law commands

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma, Pavamana, thou pourest out wealth that brings renown: Enter the lake, as one we love.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma thou flowest chasing foes and bringing wisdom and delight: Drive off the folk who love not Gods.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Pavamanas have been poured, the brilliant drops of Soma juice, For holy lore of every kind.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The Pavamanas have been shed, the beautiful swift Soma-drops, Driving all enemies afar.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: From, heaven, from out the firmament, hath Pavamana been effused Upon the summit of the earth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: O Soma, Indu, very wise, drive, being purified, with thy stream All foes, all Rākṣasas away.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Driving the Rākṣasas afar, O Soma, bellowing, pour for us Most excellent and splendid strength.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, do thou secure for us the treasures of the earih and heaven, Indu, all boons to be desired. Next: HYMN LXIV. Soma Pavamana.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Soma, thou art a splendid Steer, a Steer, O God, with steerlike sway: Thou as a Steer ordainest laws.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Steer-strong thy might is as a steer's, steerstrong thywood, steer-like thy drink A Steer indeed, O Steer, art thou.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thou, Indu, as a vigorous horse, hast neighed together steeds and kine: Unbar for us the doors to wealth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Out of desire of cows and steeds and horses. potent Soma-drops, Brilliant and swift, have been effused.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: They purified in both the hands, made beautiful by holy men, Flow onward to the fleecy cloth.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: These Soma juices shall pour forth all treasures for the worshipper From heaven and earth and firmament.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: The streams of Pavamana, thine, Finder of all, have been effused, Even as Sūrya's rays of light.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Making the light that shines from heaven thou flowest on to every form Soma, thou swellest like a sea.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Urged on thou sendest out thy voice, O Pavamana; thou hast moved, Like the God Sūrya, to the sieve.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Indu, Enlightener, Friend, hath been purified by the sages' hymns: So starts the charioteer his steed-

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Thy God-delighting wave which hath flowed to purifying seive, Alighting in the home of Law.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow to our sieve, a gladdening draught that hath most intercourse with Gods, Indu, to Indra for his drink.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Flow onward with a stream for food, made beautiful by sapient men: Indu with sheen approach the milk.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: While thou art cleansed, Song-Lover, bring comfort and vigour to the folk, Poured, Tawny One! on milk and curds.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Purified for the feast of Gods, go thou to Indra's special place, Resplendent, guided by the strong.

translator: R. T. H. Griffith — Public Domain
text: Accelerated by the hymn, the rapid drops of Soma juice Have flowed, urged onward, to the lake.
